reviews.title: Poor service - no care.
reviews.content:
Horrible Company - We had business loan with OnDeck, everything was fine until the last payment - we paid it as planned, and they rejected the payment and sent it back. We queried it, and they said they would look into it, (perhaps we had overpaid). Next thing we know, they had assigned us to a collection agency! - Zwicker and Associates - Horrible Rude and aggressive people. They Harassed the owner at his home repeatedly called and harassed me at home so much that I had to block their number, and have started harassing our staff. We asked Ondeck to intervene - but they've told us they are overworked because of the Covid crisis. We have told them if we need to pay that amount again, we would do so - but they have not come back to us, and we still get harassed daily by aggressive and rude people from Zwicker. OnDeck don't seem to care. Stay clear, get a business loan somewhere else.
Update - Ondeck are not responding to emails or calls. Their agents continue to use bad practices for collections - rude, threatening. If this is a company on deck chooses to associate with, please find your business loans elsewhere. They are refusing to deal with their own error, despite proof being provided.

reviews.title: Banks NOOOOO, OnDeck, YESSSSSSS!!!!!
reviews.content: I own a small business and we have been in business for almost 4 years now.  We needed some working capital for various reasons and went to the "home town" banks that claimed they helped small businesses.  We went to 3 different banks and all 3 turned us down.  Not to mention it took 3 months per bank to reach that decision.  We had been receiving the OnDeck pre-approval offers in the mail and I thought at this point what can it hurt.  The holiday season was upon us and after wasting 9 months with the banks I applied online.  The reply back was "more information needed" and I tho******.here we go it's going to be declined.  Literally 5 minutes later my phone rang and it was a person from OnDeck and all he needed was 3 months of bank statements proving our cash flow.  I asked him**.that's all you need? He replied, "Yes".  He called me back not even 30 minutes later and told me we were approved.  Dana is the person I've been working with and she has been fabulous!  She has not told me anything that wasn't true and has been upfront and honest through the entire process.  I got my funds, bought my inventory just in time for the holiday season and was able to end the year up 3% over the previous year when we were down 5% going into holiday.  People can complain about rates and fees but in the end all I can say is I got my money when the banks wouldn't help and I ended in the positive!  OnDeck is now the ONLY people I use for funding!

reviews.title: A great alternative to traditional banks
reviews.content:
I started with a small line of credit to see how it would go.  After 6 months I was very happy with the service and transparency and applied for a long-term loan to consolidate some old debt.  While the rates are higher than it probably would be at a traditional bank, the loan process is way simpler and shorter and that has great value to me.  I'm not a fan of traditional banks anyway, so I'm happy to support companies like OnDeck.

If you aren't good at managing money, no type of loan is going to work for you.  But if you need some capital for seasonal business or equipment, this is a very easy application process and they get the cash to you quickly.  The rates are higher, but fair.  Just manage the loan properly to keep your cost of capital to a minimum.

reviews.author: Russell

reviews.title: Exhaust all other options before using OnDeck
reviews.content: They were happy to loan money for my business.  The rates are 47%APR, payments taken daily from merchant services over a period of 18months.  They charged $2500 origination fee, and you can not pay off early without penalty.  They will get every dime even if you pay off early.  For example, if you take the loan today and want to pay it off tomorrow you will pay 100% of the principle and 75% of the interest at loan maturity.  Basically, you can pay off early but it won't save you anything in interest.  Do not work with them unless you are desperate for working capital and have exhausted all other options.  Also, go to the Better Business Bureau New York and read all of the complaints.  Do not let the A+ BBB rating fool you.  Plenty of people have complained.
reviews.author: Kevin

reviews.title: Great new online lender. Banks watch out.
reviews.content: I did look at OnDeck for small business loans. Great company. I met my capital needs with family funds but a great company indeed.
